Comment: Some authors have considered the anterior olfactory nucleus to be part of the olfactory cortex.  We have not added it here
as currently it is considered to be a nucleus
Olfactory cortex.Definition: Aggregate brain region defined as those areas of cerebral cortex receiving direct synaptic input from the olfactory bulb (Price, 1973).  The most recognized structure is the piriform cortex (prepyriform area), but other areas are often included, e.g., the olfactory tubercle.
